div.l: Be goddis sale it shal non̄ othir͗e be
Thus answerde Aleyn̄ and seid a vise þe
The myller is a parlouse man he seid
And yf þat he out of his slepe abreyd
He myght do vs both a vilony
Aleyn̄ answerd I count hym nat a flye
And vp he risith and by þe wench he crepe
This wench lay vp right and fast a slepe
Tyl he so nyȝe was or she myght aspy
That it had bene to late for to cry
And shortly for to sey they were aton̄
Nowe pley Aleyn̄ for I wol speke of Iohn
This Iohn lay stil a furlong wey or to
And to hym̄ self he makith rowith ⁊and woo
Alas quod he this is a wiccid Iape
Nowe may I sey that I is but an ape
Ȝit hath my felawe som̄ what for his harm̄
He hath the Milleris doghter in his Arm̄
He Auntrith hym̄ and hath his nedis sped
And I ly like a draf sak in my bed
And when this Iape is told anothir day
I shal be hold a daf a Cokenay
I wol arise and auntir me be my faith
Vnhardy is vn sely thus men seith
And vp he rose and softly forth he went
Vn to the Cradil and in his hond it hent
And bare it soft vn to his beddis feet
Son̄ aftir͗e this the wyfe her rowting lete
And gan a wake and went her out to pis
And cam̄ aȝen and gan the Cradil mys
And gropid her͗e and ther͗e but she fond None
Alas quod she I had al most mys goon̄
I had al most go to the Clerkis bed
Ey benedicite than̄ had I foule I sped
And forth she goith tyl she þe Cradil fond
